result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul H Pool was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) due 6 months after release. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence with good time.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul H Pool

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  4 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 7 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with good time.

Court ordered the defendant provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) due 6 months after release.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

COURT WOULD NOT ALLOW FOR EXPUNGEMENT.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department..

Defendant Paul H Pool in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Paul H Pool in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Paul H Pool in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor who appears telephonically due to personal emergency.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Irene Parthum.
For reasons stated off the record to the Court, and with the agreement of all parties, Status Conference scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  
  Status conference scheduled for 09-03-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until Plea and Sentencing adjourned to 08-07-2014 in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-07-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Paul H Pool in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-01-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Paul H Pool in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  James Griffin for Janet C. Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

14RM013625  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
3/9/14 vf

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MACY'S, JCPENNEY'S AND HENRY M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Paul H Pool in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Paul H Pool in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
